page.title: 08FISHING IN GLENLIVET
page.content: The River Avon rises in the Cairngorms and is fed by many burns and rivers, one being the Livet which rises in the Ladder Hills. These rivers have many pools where salmon and trout rest on their way to or from the spawning grounds. The fast clear water with slack areas provide ideal locations for anglers. The fishing rights to the River Livet belong to the Community and permits are sold by the Community Association to both locals and tourists with locals paying a nominal fee. Any profit is distributed to clubs and charities in the area. In Scotland you can fish for brown trout without a permit and many an angler owes his skill to hours spent in childhood fishing the small burns for trout.
